choices.C: Replace the managed switch with an unmanaged switch.
choices.B: Connect to the HTTPS management interface.
choices.A: Install a VNC plugin on the web browser.

discussion.content: Can someone please explain this answer?

comments.content: Since the command line is not there then it most likely mean they are going to use an HTTP remote session .

questions.question_text: A network administrator has discovered a low-end managed switch connected to the company's LAN. While reading about the device's specifications on the manufacturer's website, the administrator discovers the switch does not support a command-line interface for administration. Which of the following remote access methods should the administrator use to log in to the switch?

discussion.content: UDoIT2021...I completely agree! If the engineer is maintaining the application and it's associated data, it's 100% PaaS.
Shouldn't the answer be A: PaaS,? It says the engineer is providing access to the Company's application. A PaaS cloud model is designed to host company applications.

questions.question_text: A network engineer is creating a method for customers to access the company's application in a web browser. Which of the following cloud models should the customers use to access the application?
A single PRI can deliver multiple voice calls simultaneously using which of the following Layer 1 technologies?

discussion.content: ISDN BRI. The correct answer is A
Why is the answer A? Isn't Time Division Multiplexing about giving each user a time slice so how is it doing it simultaneously?
A (Time Division Multiplexing) seems correct. C and D are for wireless networks. ISDN uses digital, not analog, so B is probably wrong. That leaves option A.

A PRI is a digital, end-to-end connections that allows for multiple, simultaneous voice, data, or video transmissions. This is achieved through a physical line or circuit. The physical circuit, a cable containing two pairs of copper wires, provides 23 channels for data and or voice

Since PRIs provide blocks of 23 channels, there isn’t much room for flexible scalability. In addition, because PRIs are Circuit Switched, it’s sometimes a hassle once your company grows to a certain point; gaining multiple locations or a large number of employees.

shhould be B
Pri is part of ISDN which uses circuit switching

comments.content: It doesn't asks which type of technology it uses to deliver packets, it asks which technology helps PRI deliver their 23 voice channels, focus on the details

discussion.content: Oh, I think now I actually understand ... the question says "after how long" ... so it's practically correct the answer "after 3 days" which means the 4th day.
I think that the answer should be 4 days...but there's no answer with 4 days...am I missing sth?

comments.content: First lease renew after 1/2 of lease time i.e 6/2 = 3 days and second lease renew attempt in 7/8 of lease time ie 6x7/8 = 5.2 days.

discussion.content: Shouldn't it be 7 days, am i missing something ?

questions.question_text: A network technician is utilizing DHCP. The technician has set a six-day lease time for all hosts. After which of the following time intervals should the hosts attempt to FIRST renew their address?

A company is implementing a new firewall. The firewall is configured to allow only TCP ports 80 and 443 to exit the network and allow the same traffic back into the network using inbound stateful packet filtering. Users are not able to access URLs of common websites they visit. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of the issue?

choices.C: The firewall does not allow UDP port 53 to enter and exit the network.
choices.B: Web browsing uses UDP and not TCP ports 80 and 443.
choices.A: Stateful packet filtering only allows connections that originate outside the network to enter.
choices.D: TCP 80 and 443 should be allowed inbound and stateful inspection should be allowed outbound.

discussion.content: URL= port 80 or 443. DNS = port 53. Port 53 would need to be opened on the firewall to allow DNS traffic to pass through.
